msbt.message: Recently I was out for a stroll, when I came across something someone must have dropped.

It was a single glove! I looked all around, but I never found its mate.I can't sleep at night, wondering if that glove was special to whoever dropped it, I won't be able to rest until I get that lost glove home to its owner!
I could tell it was a journal, but the owner didn't write a name anywhere on it that I could find

I felt like it wasn't right for me to read it, but I couldn't come up with another way to find its owner. I was able to bring it back to , once I figured out it was . Now I make sure I always write my name on my own journalsâ€”on the outside, .

I feel a little guilty admitting to this, but I did finally peek inside and read some of that journal, . The author wrote so lovingly about how grateful they were to their parents It was just so sweet!
It was a copy of a new book that I knew was supposed to be great: ! I've already read it and loved it, and I hope I can find its owner so we can talk about the book, .
If I keep setting aside things I want to use but I don't end up using them, does that make me a collector?

Especially stylish ballpoint pens. I just can't stop myself from picking up any that I come across! I feel like writing in my diary with an elegant pen helps me find the perfect wording, . And doing that means that I'll end my day with a smile on my face!

While I was cleaning yesterday, I rediscovered an unused hardcover journal I'd bought, . I wanted to open and use it right away, but I couldn't come up with anything to write that was worthy So I ended up just shelving it again.
Last week, gave me a new set of paints said didn't want. I've been so excited since, dreaming up all the things I could paint with themsomeday, .
I've been drinking a lot of tea lately.

If you drink your tea with nothing else in it, you can't go wrong with the taste of Darjeeling! The tea is a faint orange color, and it has a really sweet fragrance.If you try some along with a fruity dessert, it might become your new favorite tea, .

It really is a nice way to pass the time! Have you tried milk tea? If not, I recommend Assam tea.Its sweet, malty taste mixes well with milk and sugar, .I like to sip it in the morning more than at bedtime, because it's strong and can keep me awake at night.

If you're in the mood for iced tea, my top pick would be Earl Grey.It's got a refreshing citrus scent, and a rich flavor that always puts me at ease, . I'd recommend drinking it to relax before a big test, or before you have to do some kind of presentation.
I pick up new skills faster if it's something I'm motivated to learn.There's something that I've always wanted to know how to do, that I think I'd enjoy working to master

I already love stationery and writing notes to friends, so I really want to learn proper greeting card etiquette.There's an art to matching the card to whomever you're writing to, and to composing the perfect message.I'm hoping to master that art, so I can pick out and send the ideal cards to everyone, !

I'd like to master the art of brush calligraphy. That's writing in brush strokes with ink, . It's an ancient art that takes a lot of careful practice to master.It might not sound like the most useful skill to master, but they say it's a very soothing activity.

I think it'd be good to level up my weeding skills, !Lawn maintenance is more than how many weeds you can pull. It's also about spotting hard-to-find weeds. I'm not sure if I'm capable of that level of awareness, but there's only one way to find out!

I saw a honeybee flying past, and I got bold enough to try to catch her in my net, Until I caught her I was just worried she'd sting me, but once I had her in my net I saw how cute she wasI suddenly felt guilty about capturing her, and I decided to let her go near a patch of wildflowers.

I saw a pretty butterfly while I was watering flowers, and thought about the mystery of it all, One day, a caterpillar decides to seal herself up in a cocoon, where she changes everything about herself. When she comes back out, she's this beautiful creature, free to take to the skies on colorful wings How did she decide that it was time to become something new? When did she suddenly know she was ready?

The other night, I was getting ready for bed when I found an ant that snuck inside my house. I felt bad about putting her outside, since it was raining hard that night. So she stayed inside with me. When I told the story of my new ant friend to , got jealous, !

I caught an adorable goldfish that I decided to take home as a pet.But he looked kind of lonely to me, swimming around in his little glass fishbowl, I felt sorry for him, so the next day I returned him to his river home.

The other day, I fell into a pit and it took all morning to climb back out.Half my day was ruined! I decided that it might cheer me up to try fishing for a while, .Right away, I caught this giant fish! A lucky break seems even better if things haven't been going well.

A while ago, I was walking by the water when I saw the shadow of something huge, just offshore. I rushed to cast my fishing line, thinking I had a chance at the biggest fish I might ever catch! I reeled in my line, andall I'd managed to catch was an old, filthy tire,

I watched one of those really scary movies the other night, and I've been on edge ever since. A dragonfly whizzed past my window earlier, and I was so startled I totally squished the in my hand! I never knew I had that kind of strength. I could be a danger to myself and others, !

Have you ever heard of a pile of books falling over, even though no one was around to touch them? That happened to me just the other day. I jumped so hard I spilled the cup of I was drinking! Normally it wouldn't be a big deal, but I won't be able to use my usual stain prevention this time Not spilling stuff in the first place!

I was in my room earlier, reading , when suddenlythe lights flickered. They flickered again. Flicker, flicker. And again. Flicker, flicker.Then, CRASH! The door blew open, I jumped out of my chair, and my book fell to the floor with a thump! I saw what had happened and true panic set in, .I had lost my place and would have to start reading the whole thing again from the very beginning!
I've been thinking about how you say something changes the way you feel. Like this, for example.
I FEEL GREAT!I have to admit that I do feel pretty great after that.Even ifaghI haveouch a sore throat now, .
You're fun! I like talking to you, !But wait That's how I always feel, talking to you. That just turned the volume way up, .
Let's do our very best today! Until! Today! Is! Over!That'sa lot of noise. But if I'm ever going to cheer, it'll be for our friendship, .
When you're going on a trip, you can either wing it or plan out everything. What's your style?This may surprise you, but I'm firmly on Team Planning. That's half the fun of traveling, !

Sometimes I'll spend months crafting daily trip guides so that everyone can get the most out of the vacation.Sure, I'm usually traveling alone, but Well, I can confirm those plans are always greatly appreciated!

Still, there are times when I'm sure I packed everything, but really I forgot something like my .Then I have to buy an extra, which is far from ideal. That's why I always say, "Pack, check, and check again!"

Oh, but there was one time I got to the airport only to realize I'd brought a Bell voucher instead of my ticket!I'm still certain that I actually did pack my ticket, so I consider it a bit of a lingering mystery.
